description: No one knows what was negotiated in Alaska, and no agreement was detailed. Unable to compel his Russian counterpart, the US president instead put pressure on the Ukrainians and Europeans to resolve the conflict.

description: President Aleksandar Vucic is facing accusations of sending hooligan groups to suppress the anti-corruption movement that has shaken the country for the past nine months.

headline: In France, accessible beaches help 'normalize vacations' for all
description: The 'Handiplage' label, awarded to 150 beaches across France, guarantees people with reduced mobility access to the water and amphibious wheelchairs for swimming.

headline: 'Brief History of a Family': A metaphorical tale at the heart of China's new middle class
description: Meticulously crafted, director Lin Jianjie's debut feature follows a family whose balance is upended when their son brings his best friend into their home.

headline: Haitham Karajay, chef: 'My mother cooked every day. I was lucky to have her by my side until she died'
description: 'Refugee Recipes' (6/6). Chef Haitham Karajay sought refuge in France to escape from the Syrian civil war. He quickly turned to cooking, with the support of the NGO Refugee Food, for which he now works.

headline: Video: Europe battles wildfires fueled by heatwave
description: The prolonged heatwave scorching Europe is fueling increasingly intense wildfires, driven by climate change.

headline: Hackers versus sports broadcasters: A tight match to win over viewers
description: 'Click To Pirate' (4/5). Hit later than other sectors by the scourge of piracy, the sports industry now faces a proliferation of illegal broadcasts, from Telegram to IPTV. Meanwhile, users of streaming platforms criticize what they see as inadequete legal offerings.
